title: React Introduction

metadata.description: Learn about React Introduction with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
What is React?
React is a front-end JavaScript library.
React was developed by the Facebook Software Engineer Jordan Walke.
React is also known as React.js or ReactJS.
React is a tool for building UI components.
How does React Work?
React creates a VIRTUAL DOM in memory.
Instead of manipulating the browser's DOM directly, React creates a virtual 
DOM in memory, where it does all the necessary manipulating, before making the 
changes in the browser DOM.
React only changes what needs to be changed!
React finds out what changes have been 
made, and changes
only
what needs to be changed.
You will learn the various aspects of how React does this in the rest of this 
tutorial.
What You Should Already Know
Before you continue you should have a basic understanding of the following:
HTML
CSS
JavaScript
If you want to study these subjects first, find the tutorials on our
Home page
.
React.JS History
Latest version of React.JS is 19.0.0 (December 2024).
Initial release to the Public (version 0.3.0) was in July 2013.
React.JS was first used in 2011 for Facebook's Newsfeed feature.
Facebook Software Engineer, Jordan Walke, created it.

★
+1

practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of React Introduction

quiz.question: What is React?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of React is 'a front-end JavaScript library'.

summary: This tutorial covers React Introduction concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use React Introduction effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of React Introduction and how to apply it in your projects.
